article.author: Montgomery Brewster
article.title: "Try to be less white" or why Trump nearly won
article.text:
Coca Cola are training employees to be "less white". Anyone working for big corps has probably come up against this inclusivity training. It is yet another consequence of liberal white guilt. This is a good link on it. And Mish is a liberal before anyone starts banging the far right bell. Mish follows on that this shite is why Trump nearly won. I find it hard to disagree with his blog here. Are you too white?
Is Coca Cola sponsoring racism? That's the claim. You be the judge.
www.thestreet.com
Click to expand...
You have to wonder how such absolute crap gets a foothold in businesses like Coke. I have only one answer. It is the fear that one faces when one thinks about opposing this. All it takes is a small group of loons to suggest the the company needs to be remove barriers to diversity, inclusion and equity and you have almost everyone, CEO included, quaking in their boots. This is especially true in the USA where the political leadership try to racialise almost every issue they come across. In Ireland, we must stop politicians and media outfits who try to do the same. Even if we manage to do that, it is a very tough thing to speak out when this dangerous crap comes to visit your workplace. It is especially so when the US runs the company you work for.
 
Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
